page.title: 09THE MARWICK HALL PUTTENHAM
page.content:
Before 1959 the village used the old school (replaced in 1903) as a{village {hall.}It was small and became very dilapidated and Miss Jean Marwick offered land for a new hall.
Nine sponsors contributed a third of the money needed and after help from the Ministry of Education, the village raised the rest either by subscription or by holding fetes, dances, jumble sales etc.
When Miss Marwick died her executors carried out her wishes and so the hall was named after her. It has three times won the trophy for the Best Kept Village Hall in the competition held by the Surrey Voluntary Service Council.
